scenarioDescription:
The K2-68 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-68 is a star with 0.73 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.68 times its radius. It is located 550.07 light years away from the solar system.

K2-68 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-68 system


K2-68 b

K2-68 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2016-09, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-68 b is 3.123 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-68 b is 1.580 that of Earth. At 3.123 Earth masses, K2-68 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-68, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: K2-68 - System With 1 Exoplanet
